messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Valerie and Laurie on NPR
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry this is so late.....My 10 yo dd and I listened to it together and she loved it!  Afterwards, she commented that it made her feel so good about what we
messages.messageBody:
Sorry this is so late.....My 10 yo dd and I listened to it together and she loved it! Afterwards, she commented that it made her feel so good about what we are doing. (She used the word relieved!)...I never knew that she was worried about the possibility college or the future, but Laurey and her math anxiety talk really helped alleviate some of her fears. She said, "You know, Mom, we are going down an unbeaten path"..... :) Thanks to Laurey and Valerie for doing such a great job during the interview!
Peace,
Beth

Rue Kream <skreams@...> wrote:
I haven't had a chance to listen yet, but here it is:
http://thestory.org/archive/the_story_191_School_Not.mp3/view. ~Rue

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]






Unschooling Mom to Frances (10), Will (8), Catherine (3), and Grace (14 months)
www.6uvus.blogspot.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Valerie and Laurie on NPR
messages.msgSnippet: Funny.  When I tried this link I got a message saying, Our apologies, the item you requested does not exist on this server or cannot be served. Ahh, just
messages.messageBody:
Funny. When I tried this link I got a message saying, "Our apologies, the item you requested does not exist on this server or cannot be served."

Ahh, just tried the search feature there with "unschooling" and got it. However, 4yo wants to play now so hopefully I'll be able to get it back again later!

Katharine

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Valerie and Laurie on NPR
messages.msgSnippet: We tried to find this but it appeared that they changed The Story for that day.  Does anyone know what happened/if and when it will be available? Thanks,
messages.messageBody:
We tried to find this but it appeared that they changed The Story for that day. Does anyone know what happened/if and when it will be available?

Thanks,
Katharine

----- Original Message ----
From: Rue Kream <skreams@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, February 15, 2007 10:12:57 PM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Valerie and Laurie on NPR













I'm passing this info on for Valerie Fitzenreiter (author of The Unprocessed

Child (http://www.ubpub. com/):



Valerie and her daughter Laurie were interviewed for NPR's The Story. The

interview should air Monday.



The list of stations that carry The Story (with broadcast times) can be

found on their website at: <http://thestory. org/Stations>.



There aren't any stations that carry it in Louisiana, however, WUNC does

stream online at: <http://www.wunc. org/about/ listen>



It airs at noon and 7 Lousiana time. Alternately, I understand that iTunes

carries WUNC in their library of free radio stations.

messages.subject: Valerie and Laurie on NPR
messages.msgSnippet: I m passing this info on for Valerie Fitzenreiter (author of The Unprocessed Child (http://www.ubpub.com/): Valerie and her daughter Laurie were interviewed
messages.messageBody:
I'm passing this info on for Valerie Fitzenreiter (author of The Unprocessed
Child (http://www.ubpub.com/):

Valerie and her daughter Laurie were interviewed for NPR's The Story. The
interview should air Monday.

The list of stations that carry The Story (with broadcast times) can be
found on their website at: <http://thestory.org/Stations>.

There aren't any stations that carry it in Louisiana, however, WUNC does
stream online at: <http://www.wunc.org/about/listen>

It airs at noon and 7 Lousiana time. Alternately, I understand that iTunes
carries WUNC in their library of free radio stations.
